hints.content:
The container is filled to $\goldE{45} \text { mL}$.  

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 10 milliliters to 70 milliliters. Tick marks 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, and 70 milliliters are labeled. 1 unlabeled tick mark is shown before 10 milliliters and there is 1 unlabeled tick mark between every 2 labeled tick marks. The honey inside the graduated cylinder measures to the unlabeled tick mark above 40 milliliters. A line extends from the unlabeled tick mark above 40 milliliters and is labeled 45 milliliters. !

hints.content:
The number of $\text{mL}$ of honey  in each packet is the total number of $\text{mL}$  in the container $(\goldE{45} \text { mL})$ divided by the number of packets $(\blueD5)$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The longer top rectangle is labeled 45. The shorter bottom rectangle is labeled 5. A curved bracket at the bottom of both rectangles is labeled with question mark equal groups. !

hints.content: There were $\greenD{9 \text { mL}}$ of honey in each packet.

question.content:
Sarah put $5$ packets of honey into the container below.  All of the packets held the same amount of honey.

[[☃ image 1]]

  
  **How many milliliters of honey were in each packet?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] milliliters

options.alt: A graduated cylinder labeled with tick marks from 10 milliliters to 70 milliliters. Tick marks 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, and 70 milliliters are labeled. 1 unlabeled tick mark is shown before 10 milliliters and there is 1 unlabeled tick mark between every 2 labeled tick marks. The honey inside the graduated cylinder measures to the unlabeled tick mark above 40 milliliters. !
